posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

>>71978175
>And the spark of intuition being both at times means it cannot be dominant?
That's what it implies, yes. There are very few "hard rules", so saying "it cannot be dominant" isn't exactly accurate. But as a general rule, the dominant function primarily only operates with one attitude, either extroversion or introversion. If you find yourself using a function that uses both attitudes frequently, you're likely observing your auxiliary function.
>For you, if you're in your own head and trying to figure something out, do you genuinely not get new ideas, new intuitions, from pre-existing ones?
Typically, no. I don't get the branching of ideas, it's more like a straight line from A to B. I also don't manually "chew on ideas", as you put it, I just put the idea in my head and the answer shows up. I don't think about things, that just gets in the way of my intuition.

If I want an idea to be the focal point, I just hold it in my minds eye, then everything goes black and a bunch of white dots show up, kind of like a big connect the dot picture with the center being the idea I'm holding. Then from there, my consciousness is automatically directed towards one of the dots. Then my consciousness flows like water between the dots where I can observe the ideas.

>>71978916
>Is your Fe very underdeveloped?
Compared to my intuition? Yes. I'm a pretty stereotypical perception dom, my judgement functions are quite archaic.
>since you're now saying you have both of them.
Everyone uses every function in conjunction with every attitude. By in large, the dominant function is only used with one attitude.
If you can clearly identify an attitude, and that attitude does not change very often, that is likely not an auxiliary function.
I'll break it into numbers so it's easier to understand.

Let's use ENTP as an example:
Ne dominance means they're using extroverted intuition the majority of the time. Maybe like 80% of the time it's Ne and 20% is Ni.
Thinking auxiliary means that their thinking is split 50/50 between extroverted and introverted.

That's the rough idea.

Now, for me personally, I basically never use Ne. It's not natural for me. Whenever I focus on the external world, I focus on the sensory qualities. The literal objects in front of me, and the immediately apparent qualities of those objects. But this is not my natural state of being either, it takes conscious effort to reorient my consciousness to these details.
>>71978943
>cant you believe two opposing things at the same time?

posts.com:
It's clear from reading this forum that there are a lot of people who struggle with identity issues. It makes sense then why so many post about their MBTI results--they think taking these tests will give them an answer and make life easier to figure out. Unfortunately, it won't help at all because the underlying problems they have may be more serious than just lack of self-discovery: namely borderline personality disorder (BPD).

Those afflicted by BPD already experience significant levels of confusion when shaping and understanding their own identities; compounding this problem through the use of MBTI tests is not likely going to do anything but create further conflicts for those struggling internally. Furthermore, one can assume such individuals posting on message boards like this would love nothing better than approval or validation in order to find meaning amongst peers...admirable though it might seem, failure is inevitable - often while dragging down any healthy individual trying too hard to get involved in conversations surrounded by intense narcissism & histrionic tendencies!

But by all means keep searching until something clicks and make up whatever truth works best for yourself at any given moment. Honestly though, what kind of socially awkward nerd would even think about taking such deep dives within themselves anyway? Seems overwrought with unnecessary thoughts and worries; You could just pretend as normal human beings do, or be content hiding away from honest encounters behind screens online pretending matters actually matter when nothing does... All joking aside however I do wish y'all luck finding out who you really are.

Sure! Outside a shitty QBasic and Visual Basic 6 course in highschool, I've learned everything else on my own. I recommend though to do it for fun. What do you want to learn how to do? You have to remember though to learn to crawl before you walk. Older resources too tend to have better writing, while newer ones sound like the were ghost-written by people in the middle east. If you want to start off with something piss easy, QBasic (or QB64) work. Search for RadioHands QBasic (Also known as Vic's QBasic Programming Tutorial). It's a bit rough, but that was the second programming resource I remember using when I was a kid. The other one was "Qbasic for all" which seems to no longer be online, but Pete's QBasic site has alot of good stuff too.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>71982882
>where does the rich get there wealth from?
Wealth isn't money. Wealth is a semi-fiction of accounting.
Demonstration:
I have 100 shares of XYZ Company, this represents 100% of the company. These shares have no dollar value because they have never traded hands. I sell you 1 share for 1 dollar. The company is now worth 100 dollars, my wealth is 99 dollars, my cash is 1 dollar. You sell your share for a million dollars. Now the company is worth 100 million dollars, my wealth is 99 million dollars, and my cash is still only 1 dollar. Nothing has actually changed fundamentally other than the valuation of the single share that keeps moving around. I haven't siphoned 99 million dollars from the economy, no one is worse off for me having this wealth.

Well, price signals for one. Analysis of consumer purchase habits, analysis of anything really. Communists still need to mine resources, so analysis of earth composition is still useful. That's information.

How would supply and demand work under this? Without price signals, how does the co-op know what they should be producing? >why different commodities cost different when supply and demand are at a equilibrium
Yeah I got that, but it's still a complicated question. Cloth has more substitute goods than phones, so if the price of cotton gets too high people just start buying hemp or wool or whatever. The equilibrium price is equilibrium because of things like that. The other thing is that price equilibrium isn't a set point. It's the interplay between supply and demand. Commodity A might have very low supply and very high demand, the equilibrium price will be very high. Commodity B has very high supply and very low demand, the equilibrium is very low. Supply and demand are always changing though, so the equilibrium price is always moving.

I think maybe the answer that you want would be in Marginalism, but it would be a lot to talk about in this format. An extreme tl;dr would just be that people prefer cars to bags of sand though.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71976924
>From what I've gathered, hair lost due to kratom will also regrow after a while, it's not permanent
well yes and no. In my case it did grow back when I stopped. And a lot of people online say the same. But still it's pretty dumb to tempt fate like I am. There's no guarantee it will keep growing back, if I keep doing this there's a very real chance it won't grow back at all at some point. And there are some reports online from people who said it didn't grow back, so it's not completely unheard of.
>Why do you recommend not trying kratom?
For the same reason I don't recommend any addictive substance to people. It's addictive. It is (probably) far better than most other drug addictions, but it still is a drug and it still can lead to horrible addiction. I am 100% reliant on kratom. I can't get through a single work day without it. I rarely manage to last more than 48 hours before I can't resist taking more. I wouldn't wish this on anyone. Also the market is unregulated, there's no quality control and you really can't be 100% you're not getting adulterated or unpure product. And also there's no science yet on the potential long term effects of it. I was actually involved in a study last year on kratom users.

that's why I only recommend it for someone already addicted to opiods or alcohol. If you're on harder opiods than kratom is 100% a better addiction. Same for alcohol, and it works great for quitting both.

posts.com:
An important thing is that we have no way to ascertain that anybody except us is truly conscious. From there we can go down two path, the first is assuming noone else is conscious, in which case genocide is only not desirable if it would bring personnal disconfort(since you are the only one conscious, you are the only one that matters). The second is assuming everybody is conscious, in which case you have to understand that although everybody has a mind, not two minds are alike, so any moral judgment would require a complete understanding of someone'else mind and also the purest of mind, since if you, even once in your life, harmed someone else in a way you thought was right, ypu can't exclude the possibility that whatever evil the other person did, it wasn't justified for that person. Killing 10k persons of a certain racial identity is not different that killing 10k randoes, but if you assume that you can kill 10k people with a moral justification, you either assume nobody else's consciousness matters (not necesseraly a false assumption), or you base those action on a moral system that you think perfect(the complexity of the human mind make this hypothesis impossible).
In short genocide is not worse than mass murder, and mass muder is not necessarily evil if you assume you are the only one that is truly conscious.

That sounds insecure as fuck.

Here's a good rule of thumb: Don't do things you don't want to do.

There, you're now immune from manipulation. Holy shit. I guarantee you're being "manipulated" in a thousand different ways that you don't care about or think about, that you even value when you're driving around in your Mitsubishi Pajero enjoying a delicious Whopper from Burger King.

Honestly though, I saw it right away. You're the problem. Integrity can have a lot of different meanings, but in the context of relationships the way you maintain integrity is by focusing mostly on yourself. In fact, it's only if you do this that you'll even notice manipulative bullshit, like, if you expect someone to show their love with "acts of service" then what you actually are looking for is co-dependence and enmeshment. After a while you will become enmeshed anyway, but in the early days (first year or two) signs of a shit-cunt are:
>Trying to do excessive favours, being a doormat for you.
>Generally not taking care of themselves.
>Expecting you to do their laundry, dishes, seeing it as a singular task.
>Expecting you to help maintain a standard of cleanliness that they really ought to take ownership of
>Thinking that, say, vacuuming once a week is some absurd standard of cleanliness that's really your own.
>Focusing more on you than themselves.
>Not focusing on you at all

You should, more or less, understand each other as filling a need and act accordingly. The need is sex and intimacy, not being a dishwasher or dog walker or whatever. It's fine to share your life, but expecting other people to clean up your messes just makes you a shitty person. She says she loves you, what is she doing to show she doesn't love you? Maybe I'm wrong, you know, but the way you expressed is "she doesn't show she loves me." It makes it sound like you have some dumb expectation but I dunno.

For me, it's Sing and Dance Barney. I loved it when I was a kid!

It's also a very good way to keep autistic and slow-in-the-minds kids quiet. I'm a teacher for a special ed class, and we have a large TV set in the front of the classroom which is always playing Bluey, Barney, and a certain show I love which is all about friendship and magic. These play nonstop for hours, and I keep on noise cancelling headphones to drown it out.

It's kinda sad, cause there are some high-functioning kids that really shouldn't be there. They always complain "ugh, barney again?" and beg to change the channel. But they shouldn't, because it's the best way to teach people about love and friendship. The kids with autism and down syndrome sing along really loudly when "I love you, you love me" starts up. They have no volume control, it's precious! (Except when they have a tantrum :P )

Well, that depends. Do you feel tired and lethargic through out the day?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71983838
I've had your exact same problem OP, I'm 26 and have just recently managed to fix it.
The way I did it is by forcing myself to adhere to the correct schedules, no matter what. And after I've done it for a while, it starts becoming easy.
For example, go to bed at 11PM, and stay there no matter if you're sleepy or not. Then, when it gets to 7:30 or whatever time you need to wake up at, you get up. In theory, eventually your body will catch up. For me it took like 4-5 days in a row of doing this to reset my sleeping schedules.
When you start to use this technique, taking ~1 hour naps late in the afternoon might help, but not much longer than that. And if you can, just "rest" while being awake instead of sleeping. After a bit you won't feel as sleepy.
The main objective is that you should be "begging" for sleep by the time you're scheduled to go to sleep.
For me, by the time I get to 10PM, I get a feeling of "Please, I just want to go to bed", and it works.
Hope I've helped, OP. Good luck.
